* Handles user interactions in the Chatsy application.
private static final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Greets the user with a welcome message.
* @param name The name of the application to be used in the greeting.
output("Hello! I'm " + name + "\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Displays the given message to the user with formatting.
* @param message The message to be displayed.
* Reads the next command from the user input.
* @return The user's command as a string.
* Closes the scanner used for reading user input.
* Represents a general exception in the Chatsy application.
* This class is the base class for all exceptions in Chatsy.
* Returns a string representation of the error message.
* @return The error message as a string.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a description is empty.
* Returns a string representation of the error message indicating an empty description.
* @return The error message as a string.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a file is corrupted.
* Constructs a {@code FileCorruptedException} with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path of the corrupted file.
* Returns a string representation of the error message indicating the file is corrupted.
* @return The error message as a string.
return "OOPS, the file " + this.filePath + " seems to be corrupted.\n";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when there is an issue with file permissions.
* Constructs a {@code FilePermissionException} with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path of the file with permission issues.
* Returns a string representation of the error message indicating a file permission issue.
* @return The error message as a string.
return "Oops, an error occurred when creating / writing a local file.\n"
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid command is encountered.
* Returns a string representation of the error message indicating an invalid command.
* @return The error message as a string.
return "I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid task index is provided.
* Returns a string representation of the error message indicating an invalid task index.
* @return The error message as a string.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a task string is in an invalid format.
* Returns a string representation of the error message indicating an invalid task string format.
* @return The error message as a string.
return "The task data is in an invalid format.";
* Represents a general exception related to local file operations in the Chatsy application.
* Constructs a {@code LocalFileException} with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path of the file causing the exception.
* Returns a string representation of the error message indicating a local file issue.
* @return The error message as a string.
return "OOPS, an error occurred with file " + this.filePath;
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Constructs a {@code DeadlineTask} with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The deadline for the task.
* Constructs a {@code DeadlineTask} with the specified description, deadline, and completion status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The deadline for the task.
* @param isDone The completion status of the task.
public DeadlineTask(String description, LocalDate by, boolean isDone) {
* Returns the deadline for this task.
* Returns a string representation of this task, including its status and deadline.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Returns the string format of this task for saving to a file.
* @return The save format of the task as a string.
* Represents a task that spans a specific time range, such as an event.
* Constructs an {@code EventTask} with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public EventTask(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Constructs an {@code EventTask} with the specified description, start time, end time, and completion status.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
* @param isDone The completion status of the event.
public EventTask(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to, boolean isDone) {
* Returns the start time of this event.
* @return The start time as a {@code LocalDateTime}.
* Returns the end time of this event.
* @return The end time as a {@code LocalDateTime}.
* Returns a string representation of this event, including its status, start time, and end time.
* @return The string representation of the event.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HH:mm");
return "[E]" + getStatusIcon() + description + " (from: " + from.format(formatter) + " to: " + to.format(formatter) + ")";
* Returns the string format of this event for saving to a file.
* @return The save format of the event as a string.
* Represents a generic task in the Chatsy application.
* This class is abstract and serves as the base class for specific task types.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns the status icon of this task, indicating whether it is done or not.
* @return The status icon as a string.
* Returns the description of this task.
* @return The task description as a string.
* Returns the completion status of this task.
* @return {@code true} if the task is done, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns the string format of this task for saving to a file.
* @return The save format of the task as a string.
* Returns a string representation of this task.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Represents a task that needs to be done without a specific deadline or time range.
* Constructs a {@code TodoTask} with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructs a {@code TodoTask} with the specified description and completion status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param isDone The completion status of the task.
* Returns a string representation of this task, including its status.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Returns the string format of this task for saving to a file.
* @return The save format of the task as a string.
DeadlineTask deadlineTask = new DeadlineTask("Submit assignment", deadline);
EventTask eventTask = new EventTask("Team meeting", from, to);
